hero.headline: Apple Research App
hero.subhead: Launching the first participant-facing research hub on iPhone and Apple Watch.
hero.summary: Built and owned the Apple Research app (2019 launch), enabling everyday users to join longitudinal health studies and share secure sensor data with top institutions.

assets.heroAlt: Abstract gradient suggesting the Apple Research app

metrics.label: Participants enrolled across women’s health, heart & movement, and hearing studies.
Environmental sound exposure logged for the Apple Hearing Study.
Co-created with Harvard Chan School, NIH, and the University of Michigan.

highlights.label: Cycle tracking insights
highlights.description: Research data informed improvements to Health app predictions.

highlights.label: Secure data collection
highlights.description: Architected high-fidelity sensor ingestion with on-device privacy controls.

highlights.label: Research tools on-device
highlights.description: Transformed iPhone and Apple Watch into remote study kits with surveys, tasks, and reminders.

references.quote: The Research app makes it easier than ever for people to contribute to groundbreaking studies.
The new Research app is a game changer—empowering iPhone and Apple Watch users to securely contribute to discoveries.
Apple’s Research app offers an unprecedented scale for medical studies by leveraging everyday devices.

hero.headline: Smart Stack Workout Suggestions
hero.subhead: Proactive coaching surfaced right on the Apple Watch home interface.
hero.summary: Led the workout intelligence portion of Smart Stack, shipping on-device models that surface the right workout card exactly when it’s time to move.

metrics.label: Shipped to millions of Apple Watch users in the 2023 redesign.
Recommendations computed locally to preserve privacy and responsiveness.
Highlighted during the Apple Watch Series 9 launch demo.

highlights.label: Routine intelligence
highlights.description: Used motion and location signals to time workout prompts when routines suggested it was time to move.

highlights.label: WidgetKit collaboration
highlights.description: Partnered with design to craft glanceable cards with playful metrics and streaks.

highlights.label: Engagement uplift
highlights.description: Early dogfooding showed higher daily workout starts compared to legacy notifications.

references.quote: watchOS 10 introduces Smart Stack, delivering relevant widgets just when users need them.
Discover how Smart Stack surfaces timely widgets to help people take action in the moment.
Smart Stack’s workout cards feel like having a coach tap you on the wrist at just the right time.

hero.headline: Journal for iPhone
hero.subhead: Personal reflection, protected by Apple’s privacy architecture.
hero.summary: Built Apple’s Journal app for iOS 17.2, giving people a dedicated, private space to capture everyday moments with on-device intelligence creating prompts.

metrics.label: Launched globally in December 2023 with the iOS 17.2 release.
Suggestion engine runs entirely on device across photos, workouts, and media.
Introduced Journaling Suggestions API for third-party developers.

highlights.label: Rich media entries
highlights.description: Support for photos, videos, audio snippets, and locations to enhance memories.

highlights.label: Privacy-first architecture
highlights.description: End-to-end encryption with optional Face ID or Touch ID lock.

highlights.label: Wellness programs
highlights.description: Scheduled notifications and gratitude prompts grounded in positive psychology research.

highlights.label: Ecosystem impact
highlights.description: Praised by Day One founder as ushering in a new chapter for digital journaling.

references.quote: Journal helps iPhone users reflect on everyday moments and preserve their memories.
Apple’s Journal app arrives with thoughtful design and deep integrations across the iPhone experience.
Journal ushers in a new chapter for the practice of digital journaling.

hero.headline: AirPods Pro Hearing Aid Mode
hero.summary: Developed Apple’s first FDA-authorized over-the-counter hearing aid software for AirPods Pro 2, delivering personalized amplification after an iPhone-based hearing test.

metrics.label: First over-the-counter hearing aid software cleared in September 2024.
Clinical validation matched performance of professionally fitted hearing aids.
Pure-tone audiometry completed entirely on iPhone to build a personal profile.

highlights.label: Dynamic amplification
highlights.description: AirPods boost targeted frequencies in real time based on the user’s profile.

highlights.label: Accessibility mission
highlights.description: Addresses the 75% of people with diagnosable hearing loss who do not use any aid.

highlights.label: Hearing health suite
highlights.description: Part of an all-in-one experience alongside Hearing Test and Hearing Protection features.

references.quote: Apple introduces groundbreaking health features, including turning AirPods Pro into FDA-authorized hearing aids.
FDA authorizes the first over-the-counter hearing aid software device.
AirPods Pro are about to double as hearing aids you can set up from your couch.

hero.headline: Apple Fitness on Every iPhone
hero.subhead: Unlocking activity tracking without requiring Apple Watch.
hero.summary: Opened up Apple’s Fitness app to all iPhone users (iOS 16+), delivering Move rings, workout tracking, and Fitness+ access without a watch.

metrics.label: Removed the Apple Watch requirement for the Fitness app in 2022.
Delivered lock screen workout stats for in-progress sessions.
Extended premium studio classes to iPhone-only customers.

highlights.label: Workouts tab
highlights.description: Built the iPhone-native Workouts tab to start runs, cycling, HIIT, and more directly on the phone.

highlights.label: Sensor handoff
highlights.description: Coordinated data flows between iPhone, Apple Watch, Bluetooth heart-rate monitors, and AirPods.

highlights.label: Activity integration
highlights.description: Counts steps, distance, and flights climbed to fill the Move ring even without a watch.

references.quote: Later this fall, all iPhone customers will be able to subscribe to Apple Fitness+.
You can track your daily activity on iPhone even if you don’t have an Apple Watch.
Apple is sherlocking basic fitness tracking by baking it directly into every iPhone.
